Constructor Detail

MessageConnection

public MessageConnection(Identity id,
                         ConnectionSet cs,
                         HeartbeatProtocol hbp,
                         Candidate can)
Constructor used to create a MessageConnection when the implementation is yet to be built. If this end is initiating then the implementation should be constructed asynchronously by MessageConnectionInititor using its own thread - done to avoid blocking the connectionSet. If this end is not initiating then this object will wait around until the MessageConnectionServer implements its implementation in response to a connection request from the other end.

Parameters:
id - - the identity of this node
cs - - the connection set
can - - the heartbeat connection (used to get details of the connection)
Method Detail

receiveHeartbeat

public boolean receiveHeartbeat(Heartbeat hb)
Over-ride the receiveHeartbeat() method. Message connections ignore heartbeats received out of band (i.e. delivered from the multicast heartbeat). Only heartbeats received in-band on their own connection counts.

Specified by:
receiveHeartbeat in interface HeartbeatReceiver
Overrides:
receiveHeartbeat in class HeartbeatProtocolAdapter
Parameters:
hb - - the heartbeat
Returns:
- always false (not valid)

terminate

public void terminate()
Connection interface - to terminate (kill as opposed to close) the connection. There will be no callback to closing() as a result of terminating the transport.

Specified by:
terminate in interface Connection
Specified by:
terminate in interface HeartbeatProtocol
Overrides:
terminate in class HeartbeatProtocolAdapter

closing

public void closing()
closing() is used by the transport to indicate that it is closing. If the transport detects an error condition it will close itself and call this method.

deliver

public void deliver(byte[] bytes)
General deliver method - any messaage received by the transport will be delivered using this method. The message will be a valid TimedMsg!

Parameters:
bytes - - the message

sendObject

public void sendObject(java.lang.Object obj)
sendObject() creates a message to transport an object and calls sendMsg() to send it. It also time-stamps the message. The object must be serializable.

Parameters:
obj - - the object to transport

sendMsg

public void sendMsg(TimedMsg tm)
Parameters:
tm -

sendBytes

public void sendBytes(byte[] bytes)

assignImpl

public boolean assignImpl(IOConnection impl)
Inform the messageConnection that an implementation of the connection has been created. When a new connection is completed any outstanding messages should be sent. If there is a disconnect pending then immediately inform the connectionSet to disconnect.

Parameters:
impl -
Returns:
boolean

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Instruct the messageConnection to disconnect. If there are no messages waiting to be sent then this can be done immediately (by informing the connectionSet of the disconnect - it is actually done via a check on heartbeat delivery, not now). If there are messages pending it implies that the connection has not been created yet and there are messages to send, so we still want to connect even if the application layer no longer wants to send. In this case that there is a disconnect pending but don't tell the connectionSet to disconnect yet.

connect

public void connect()
Indicate to the MessageConnection that a connect has been called. The purpose is to cancel a pending disconnect.

setIgnoring

public void setIgnoring(boolean ignoring)
for testing - can set the connection to ignore messages - they will be received, but just dropped

Parameters:
ignoring -
